entry.title: REVIEW of Section A: Assignment: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night Time
entry.content:
This dialogue contains all of the relevant information you need in order to answer the question by writing about an event in the novel from the perspective of Mr Boone.  Well done.

I understand why you gave the policeman those questions -- you needed Mr Boone to reply with the correct information.  However, how else could the policeman ask those questions without sounding as if he is accusing Mr Boone of doing something bad?  Policemen can't legally do that.  Try again, and imagine HOW you would ask those same questions in a neutral way.
 
MR. Boone
Excuse me, officer; I'd like to report a missing child.
Policeman
Alright, can you please describe the boy to me?
MR.BOONE
He has a rat in his pocket with its head sticking out, he is 13 years of age, and he would have wandered around in the station for a while before taking the train.
POLICEMAN
Hmm... okay, where was the child heading to? How would you even know if he was here or not? (Is this how a policeman would speak? "How would you even know... ?" is what you say when you making an accusation)
MR.BOONE
Early in the morning, I was going down to the kitchen to grab (make?) some breakfast for me and for my child, and as I went down, I see a note on the table saying that he was leaving to London, where his mother lives. he obviously had snuck out wrote me a letter saying that he is going to see his mother, He did not mention anything about the train station, but it's the only way I imagine he could get to London from here. is catching the trains in this train station. Sir, Officer, I am very worried about his safety, he has got autism is autistic and he does not know the outside world, I need to get to him as soon as possible!
POLICEMAN
Why did run out of the house sir? Did you do anything that bad to cause him going all the way from London? (This sounds like an accusation)
MR.BOONE
Well, I killed our family's dog and he got really mad with me because he did not like people and he really liked his dog, he understood the dog more than he understood people, I do not have any time constable, I need to hurry up before he will be on his way to another city! I did not even imagine how bad he would have reacted to this and would have actually do this to me, I love him and I want him back safe.
POLICEMAN
Sure thing, he escorted him to buy a ticket, and how to get on the train to London, I know exactly who it is now... speaking of train tickets, and do you have your train ticket on you?
MR.BOONE
Thank you very much for you assistance constable, I do not have my ticket on me at the moment but I got some spare cash on me, after all he took my credit card and he should have been stopped for doing that. You should have also stopped him from trying to run away, he probably told you all about how he wants to run away and how I am bad.
POLICEMAN
No problem, but Why in the first place would he have gone to London?
MR.BOONE
To see his mother of course, anyways I am going to go off to the train, its coming in 2 minutes. If you see him around here again, please keep him with you because I will come back and see if he has came back.
POLICEMAN
Will do sir, I will let the other constables know about this.'
MR.BOONE
And again, thank you kindly constable, I really appreciate that.
POLICEMAN
That's my job.

entry.title: REVIEW of Section B: Essay, The novel is about being different.
entry.content:
The novel: "The curious incident of the dog at night time" is about being different




GENERAL NOTES:

Your essay satisfies the most important criterion: it answers the question, so well done. Follow my comments to make the essay better.  I want to draw your attention to a couple of points diction and punctuation during our next lesson.  Otherwise, it's looking good.

 ****

You need to add an introduction.  It should look like the following.  That means you should take this and re-write it in your own words.


The novel "The Curious Incident of the Dog at Night Time" by (author) gives an account of what it means to be different.  It tells the story of a teenaged boy called Christopher, and the decisions he makes in response to disturbing incident reveal that although being "different" can be difficult, it is important to recognise how we are different from each other in order to better understand each other's perspective.

Christopher is obviously an exceptionally unusual person because of his autism. Extreme Autism is what Christopher has got, and its very rare, which makes him exceptionally an unusual type of different. He is different throughout the book at the cause of him not being able to socialize with people and being even more sociable with animals,    
First, establish that Christopher is "different"; then, point out that has things in common with other boys his age:

 CHRISTOPHER IS DIFFERENT





Christopher is most obviously different from his classmates in that he is autistic.  This means that he connects better with animals rather than humans, and he owns a pet rat. [Do the other boys think that keeping a rat as a pet is strange?]

Christopher has an extreme dislike of being touched, and he even hit a policeman for touching him, that is an unusual act that people at 15 of age (which is his age too) would not do, he talks with too much unnecessary detail and he speaks it very fast.

He is exceptionally intelligence intelligent. He is able to calculate the volume of a police cell in in a few seconds with in his head only, he always calculates the things around him and get gets the the right answers straight away, he likes to be organized by having a timetable that make him feel good when he knows what he is doing everyday.

CHRISTOPHER HAS THINGS IN COMMON WITH HIS CLASSMATES

Although that Christopher is a very different person from people certainly unusual he is also the same like other people, he had has a dog as his pet, he has a normal family, he wants to be famous, he wants to be a successful person like Sherlock Holmes, (this is good, but the next few things show again he is different)

CHRISTOPHER IS DIFFERENT

he wants to achieve things, he even wrote a book, and get an 'A' grade on his subjects, he still had a friend and her name is Siobhan, she taught him how society works , and how to react to it, although these are minor similarities with other people.

The meaning of being different is being not alike in character,  Christopher does not know if he is sad or happy about being that different, although, the symptoms of Autism cause him to be sad and happy, he is happy that he can socialize with animals because they are more simpler to him than people that he talks to, being able to have his day like he wants it in a schedule, although he is sad because; he is unable to work out how being social works between different people from him and between him, he exceptionally does not like loud noises, he does not like being touched.

If Christopher had a choice to not be Autistic, he wouldn't have known whats better for him which is another symptom caused by Autism, if he wanted to not be Autistic he would have done it for being social with people and experiencing new things.
 In my humble (Do not say "in my humble opinion" unless you have a reason to use "humble") opinion, would say that being an Autistic person is negative and positive,. in our age, Autistic people are not as popular, not sociable, do not seem to have more than 1 to 2 friends and seems like everyone makes fun of them, they seem to get annoyed easily and are very delicate with everything you do with them, it is very hard to be Autistic, although,on the bright side being Autistic could mean that you are able to be someone like Stephen Hawking, which he is also known for his gigantic amounts of knowledge, (Stephen Hawking is not autistic -- do a Google search for "famous autistic people") Autism may cause you to have an amazing amount of memory, exceptionally intelligent exceptional intelligence, got his own way of thinking which i would like to have too. (I don't understand what you mean by this last part) When I first came from Israel to Australia, I felt isolated from the people around here because I was very different from the people around here.  I didn't like footy or cricket, but I was willing to try it out, I was too bad at it not very good at these sports / I didn't really enjoy these sports / I struggled to play these games well and hoped I would mix with them.  (I don't understand what you mean by "mix with them")

In the end, I learned how to mix with people that I want to mix with pretty well, everything takes time.

By: Evya Mati
